SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.thinktel.foragingBee.simulation
Class Bee

java.lang.Object
  de.thinktel.foragingBee.simulation.AbstractMovingAgent
      de.thinktel.foragingBee.simulation.Bee
All Implemented Interfaces:
IIterationAgent, IMovingAgent, IVisualAgent, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
public class Bee
extends AbstractMovingAgent

This class defines the behaviour of the bee inside this simulation. The bee is modeled as a state based automaton that performs certain action according to its state.
The class implements the basic methods iterate() that will perform the state specific code during execution of the object.

Changes:

  • 20090822: currentTargetLocation added so the bee can orientate itself to the current target after avoiding an obstacle. This location is used to simulate the bee's ability to track the current location even during avoiding obstacles.
  • 20090824: The avoidance of bees has been removed. It is to less space in the simulated world to avoid other (bigger) obstacles.
  • 20090825: Every bee informs it's food source that the bee locked and unlocked on. The food sources count the locked bees.
  • 20090908: All angular methods are now working with radians.
  • 20090915: Major rewrote the code regarding computing angles and distances.
  • 20090917: Avoiding an obstacle will check first if the obstacle is farer away than a target location. Prior to this modification returning bees were avoiding the hive hence weren't able to get into the entrance (close to the hive).
  • 20090917: Improved checking for the bounds of the simulation (the previous method was not working properly to be honest).
  • 20090920: Changed some methods to behave accordingly to the AbstractMovingAgent.is3dMode() mode.

Copyright 2009 Joerg Hoehne

Author:
hoehne (Jörg Höhne)

private static final double honeyShrinkFactor
The conversion factor from nectar to honey. Approximately 2.5 units of nectar will result in one unit honey.

private static final double honeyExpandFactor
The conversion factor from honey to nectar. One unit of honey will result in approximately. 2.5 units of nectar.

Constant Field Values

hive

Hive hive
The hive where the bee belongs to.

foodSource

FoodSource foodSource
The source of food the bee remembers, either by information or by the last foraging trip.

sourceConcentration

double sourceConcentration
The concentration of nectar for the last remembered source.

sourceDirection

J3dPolar sourceDirection
The calculated direction from the hives entrance to the source. The radius is the computed distance to the source. The distance to the source will be altered by the bee during flight.

currentTargetLocation

javax.vecmath.Point3d currentTargetLocation
The current target location the bee will heading to. This point is necessary if the bee is avoiding obstacles because after the avoidance the new direction has to recomputed.

nectarLoad

double nectarLoad
The current nectar load retrieved from a source.

sourceQuality

double sourceQuality
The computed quality of the last source.

foragingCosts

double foragingCosts
The costs for doing foraging (the last trip).

state

private Bee.State state
The current state of the bee.

receptive

boolean receptive
True if the bee is receptive to other bees, used to listen to other dancing bees.

repeatedDance

int repeatedDance
A counter for the statistics how often a bee is successive dancing.

dancingThreshold

double dancingThreshold
The probability a bee will start dancing. This value also affects the duration of dancing. Every step the probability the value is reduced. Distinctive values represent certain states:
  • -1: no dancing
  • [0,1[: no dancing, set this value to -1
  • >=1: dancing

dancingTime

int dancingTime
The number of cycles the bee invests in dancing.

repeatedTrip

int repeatedTrip
The number of successive trips to the same food source.

searchSteps

int searchSteps
The remaining number of search steps the bee will perform until giving up searching.

           boolean is3dMode,
           Hive hive,

Method Detail

Conversion from nectar to honey.

Parameters:
nectar - The amount of nectar to be converted.
Returns:
The converted honey equivalent.

requestNectarFromHive

private double requestNectarFromHive(double nectar)
Retrieve some nectar equivalent from the hive. If the request is greater than the stomach of the bee (nectarStomach) then it is limited to this value. If the hive has less equivalent available only this amount is returned.

Parameters:
nectar - The amount of nectar requested.
Returns:
The amount of nectar equivalent the hive can provide

step

public final void step(sim.engine.SimState state)
The overwritten method for the MASON interface for a single step for this object during simulation. This method calls iterate().

Parameters:
state - The current simulation.

iterate

public void iterate()
The state specific iteration of the bee. This method will call the code according to the current state.

doStateInHiveWithoutInfo

protected void doStateInHiveWithoutInfo()
The bee is in mode in hive without any information about a food source. With a given probability the bee starts scouting or otherwise does a step inside the hive by invoking method goInHive() that will check if the bee has contact to a dancing bee.

doStateInHiveWithInfo

protected void doStateInHiveWithInfo()
The bee has information about a food source and is inside the hive. The bee wanders around, may listen to other dancing bees, may switch into state dancing or starts foraging again.
This method differs from the original model by setting the bee to non receptive during dancing.

doStateLeaveHive

protected void doStateLeaveHive()
This method is invoked if the bee will leave the hive. First the bees heads to the center of the entrance. If the bee is inside the entrance's sphere the bee will head in the current direction until the sphere is left.
This method has to differ between the states startForaging and scouting according if the bee currently has stored information about a food source.

doStateDancing

protected void doStateDancing()
The bee is in the state dancing. After the dancing time elapsed the bee will switch into the state in hive with info.
The state dancing is marked just by the state. The bee shows no special behaviour in this simulation. Other bees recognize this state and copies information about the food source from this bee.

doStateForaging

protected void doStateForaging()
The bee is in the foraging mode that means it has information about a food source and tries to find it.
The bee heads to the given direction until the distance is reached. Then the bee switches to state searching. If the bee runs out of fuel (nectar) during foraging it will return by switching to state returnWithoutInfo.

doStateSearching

protected void doStateSearching()
The bee arrived at the estimated food source position and now starts searching for the food source. The bee performs a random walk for the set search steps (encoded in searchSteps). If the food source is not found the bee switch to state returnWithoutInfo. If the food source is found the bee fetches nectar and heads to the hive. If the bee runs out of nectar during searching it switches to returnWithoutInfo.

doStateReturnWithInfoAndLoad

protected void doStateReturnWithInfoAndLoad()
The bee is in returning mode and has information about a food source and some nectar load. This method invokes method doCommonReturnToHive() that distinguish between the states with information and without.

doStateUnloadQueue

protected void doStateUnloadQueue()
Process the bee being in the unload queue. This method is even invoked if the bee has no nectar load and no information about a food source so this case has to be handled.

doStateScouting

protected void doStateScouting()
The bee is in state scouting and and behaves as follows:
  • With a probability of p(.2) it will turn by an angle between -20 and 20 degrees.
  • It makes one step forward in the current direction.
  • It will sense if any food source is around.

doStateReturnWithoutInfo

protected void doStateReturnWithoutInfo()
The bee is in returning mode and has no information about a food source. This method invokes method doCommonReturnToHive() that distinguish between the states with information and without.

doStateDead

protected void doStateDead()
Prepare to let this bee die. Set it into the terminated step. This is necessary because the agent will be called once more before totally removed from simulation.

doStateTerminated

protected void doStateTerminated()
Remove the agent from the simulation.

doCommonReturnToHive

private void doCommonReturnToHive()
This method leads the bee to the entrance of the hive. After reaching the entrance the bee will head to the unload queue even if no nectar is loaded.

goInHive

private void goInHive()
Do a step in the hive. The bee performs a random walk by invoking doStepWalking(). With a certain probability the bee listen to an other bee that is dancing.

doStepReturning

private void doStepReturning(javax.vecmath.Tuple3d targetLocation)
Fly back to the hive. This method uses the parametrized method doStepFlying(Tuple3d, boolean, boolean).

Parameters:
targetLocation - The location the bee is heading for, null keeps current the course.

doStepOutgoing

private void doStepOutgoing(javax.vecmath.Tuple3d targetLocation)
Fly away from the hive. This method uses the parametrized method doStepFlying(Tuple3d, boolean, boolean).

Parameters:
targetLocation - The location the bee is heading for, null keeps current the course.

doStepFlying

private void doStepFlying(javax.vecmath.Tuple3d targetLocation,
                          boolean checkBoundaries,
                          boolean checkHive)
Do flying. During the flight is checked if the boundaries of the simulation are left. If so the bee is reverting the flying vector. This method takes the current target position in account when setting the new direction. If no target is given the current direction is kept and only the avoidance of objects is computed.

Parameters:
targetLocation - The location the bee is heading for, null keeps current course
checkBoundaries - True if to check if the bee will fly inside the simulations boundaries.
checkHive - Check if to avoid the hive.

computeAvoidance

private javax.vecmath.Vector3d computeAvoidance(javax.vecmath.Tuple3d targetLocation)
Compute the avoidance of objects by:
  • Get all objects that might collide with or are near within 5 times of the sphere radius of this bee. Consider the sphereRadius of all objects.
  • Get all objects in an angle of +/- 90 degrees of flight direction.
  • The urge to avoid an object is the higher the closer the object is.
  • An avoidance vector to an obstacle will not be computed if the target location is closer than the obstacle itself.

Parameters:
targetLocation - The location the bee is heading for, null keeps current course

checkToAvoid

private boolean checkToAvoid(IMovingAgent agent)
Check if an agent has to be avoided by this agent. The avoidance is computed according to the state.

Parameters:
agent - The agent to be checked if it has to be avoided.
Returns:
True, if the agent has to be avoided by this agent.

doStepWalking

private void doStepWalking()
Do a step inside the hive.

foundSource

private FoodSource foundSource()
Is a FoodSource to be found by this bee? If so, return the found food source.

Returns:
The found food source.

nearFoodSource

private FoodSource nearFoodSource()
Return a food source a bee is near by. If more than one food source is in the perimeter of the bee one is randomly chosen.

Returns:
One (if more) of the food source, nil otherwise.

                          Bee.State nextState)
Reset all information about the last or current food source; set the current color and the next state.

listenToDancingBee

private void listenToDancingBee()
Listen to a dancing bee if one is around and be chosen to listen. Switch to foraging if listened to dancing bee.

private Bee.State getState()

setTargetLocation

private void setTargetLocation(J3dPolar direction)
Set the current target location according to the given direction. The bee defines the location according from the entrance of the hive.

Parameters:
